intro: Scaphochlamys reticosa, commonly known as the netted scaphochlamys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive net-like venation on its leaves, which gives it its specific epithet "reticosa." The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often with a woolly appearance. It is typically found in moist, tropical or subtropical regions, thriving in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
